result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tony N Xiong

Waive reading of Information. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.

Arraignment on August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

08:40 AM Defendant Tony N Xiong appeared by Zoom with attorney Allison Marie Ritter who appeared by Zoom.  Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.

The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  
Attorney Ritter requests an arraignment date.
The Court will set an arraignment date back before this court.  Arraignment scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  The Court will allow for the defendant to appear by Zoom at the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 13, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
